net.jawr.web.config

Class JawrConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jawr.web.config.JawrConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class JawrConfig
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class holds configuration details for Jawr in a given ServletContext.
    Author:
    Jordi Hernández Sellés, Ibrahim Chaehoi, Matt Ruby
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getContextPathOverride

        public String getContextPathOverride()
        Get the the string to use instead of the regular context path. If it is an empty string, urls will be relative to the path (i.e, not start with a slash).

        The string to use instead of the regular context path.

      • isCssClasspathImageHandledByClasspathCss

        public boolean isCssClasspathImageHandledByClasspathCss()
        Returns true if the URL of the image defines in CSS loaded from classpath, should be overridden for the classpath CSS image servlet.
        Returns:
        true if the image defines in CSS load from classpath, should be overridden for the classpath CSS image servlet, false otherwise. So if you have a CSS define in a jar file at 'style/default/assets/myStyle.css, where you have the following statement: background:transparent url(../../img/bkrnd/header_1_sprite.gif) no-repeat 0 0; Becomes: background:transparent url(getCssImageServletPath()+style/default/ img/bkrnd/header_1_sprite.gif) no-repeat 0 0; And the CSS image servlet will be in charge of loading the image from the classpath.

      • setCssClasspathImageHandledByClasspathCss

        public void setCssClasspathImageHandledByClasspathCss(boolean classpathCssHandleImage)
        Set the flag indicating if the URL of the image defines in CSS loaded from classpath, should be overridden for the classpath CSS image servlet.
        Parameters:
        useClasspathCssImgServlet - the flag to set So if you have a CSS define in a jar file at 'style/default/assets/myStyle.css, where you have the following statement: background:transparent url(../../img/bkrnd/header_1_sprite.gif) no-repeat 0 0; Becomes: background:transparent url(getCssImageServletPath()+style /default/img/bkrnd/header_1_sprite.gif) no-repeat 0 0; And the CSS image servlet will be in charge of loading the image from the classpath.

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidate this configuration. Used to signal objects that have a hold on this instance but cannot be explicitly notified when the configuration is reloaded.
